answers.answer: Dizziness could be due to abnormal blood sugar level. You can have it checked.Hope you have a Blood sugar testing kit.inox

question: I have type 2 diabetes but I don't have to take medicine because I work very hard to keep it under control.  I watch my diet and exercise quite a bit.  My last A1C was 5.7 but I am having a problem that started this morning.  When I got up this morning my sugar was a little low.  I ate my breakfast like I normally do.  But I found this I am a little dizzy.  It is past 2:00 p.m. and I am still dizzy and feeling I am really tired.  I do have a slight headache but nothing that I would think that I should need to see a doctor.  Is the diabetes causing this problem:?  If not, can you give me any idea what it could be?
title: Dizziness related to diabetes?
